com.whirvis.jraknet.chat.server.command

Class CommandHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.whirvis.jraknet.chat.server.command.CommandHandler

  • public class CommandHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Used by the ChatServer to register and handle commands.
    Since:
    JRakNet v2.0.0
    Author:
    Trent "Whirvis" Summerlin

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandHandler

        public CommandHandler(ChatServer server)
        Creates a command handler.
        Parameters:
        server - the server that the command handler belongs to.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the server is null.

    • Method Detail

      • registerCommand

        public void registerCommand(Command command)
                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Registers the specified command.
        Parameters:
        command - the command to register.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the command is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if another command with the same label as the specified command already exists and cannot be overriden.

      • registerCommand

        public void registerCommand(java.lang.Class<? extends Command> commandClazz)
                     throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                            java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Registers a command by its specified class.

        For this method to function, the specified class must have a constructor with the first and only argument being a ChatServer.

        Parameters:
        commandClazz - the command class.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the commandClazz is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the commandClazz does not have the needed constructor for proper instantiation, it is inaccessable, or if another command with the same label as the newly instantiated command with the specified commandClazz already exists and cannot be overriden.

      • unregisterCommand

        public void unregisterCommand(java.lang.String label)
        Unregisters a command.
        Parameters:
        label - the label of the command to unregister.

      • handleInput

        public void handleInput(java.lang.String input)
                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        Handles the specified input as a command.
        Parameters:
        input - the input to process and handle.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the input is null.
